At Cardinal Health, we're developing the innovative products and services that make healthcare safer and more productive. Join a growing, global company genuinely committed to making a difference for our customers and communities.

The Company and Business

Headquartered in Dublin, Ohio, Cardinal Health, Inc. (NYSE: CAH) is a global, integrated healthcare services and products company, providing customized solutions for hospitals, healthcare systems, pharmacies, ambulatory surgery centers, clinical laboratories and physician offices worldwide. The company provides clinically proven medical products and pharmaceuticals and cost-effective solutions that enhance supply chain efficiency from hospital to home. Cardinal Health connects patients, providers, payers, pharmacists and manufacturers for integrated care coordination and better patient management. Job brief

The General Manager China is responsible for the leadership and business performance of Cardinal Health in China. The China GM will be responsible for thoughtful leadership of the country’s commercial efforts including but not limited to its business strategy, business development, portfolio management, and P&L performance. The role will also coordinate and influence supporting functions to ensure each are aligned with global and regional strategies and in accordance with regulators, compliance corporate policies and local regulations, policies, and practices.

The role will be responsible for developing a comprehensive business strategy and driving market share gains by growing all major product categories, and by working with local and regional commercial leadership to develop downstream strategies & market appropriate local execution plans. The China GM will be responsible for driving “Customer Centricity” and optimizing commercial effectiveness. The role will lead a team of commercial professionals including sales managers, marketing manager, and government affairs manager. The China GM will also be responsible for driving open culture, championing DE&I, and developing talent within China team.

This is a highly visible leadership position, needing to collaborate closely and influence regional marketing, regional business leaders, local sales and marketing teams, and every supporting function.

This role will report to the Managing Director Asia Direct Markets and will be a key member of our Asia Direct Market’s leadership team. The role will preferably be based in Shanghai.

  • Lead China business and effectively partner-up with commercial teams and functional leaders to deliver on strategic and tactical plans for this business

  • Develop business strategy for all Cardinal Heath Medical Products including Specialty, OR and Gen Med portfolios.

  • Ensure cross-functional collaboration and alignment to the strategic plans for successful execution.

Job Title: Inventory QIC Coordinator at Cardinal Health
Job Description:
JOB TITLE: Senior Coordinator, Inventory Management (QIC) - Profiler

What Inventory Management contributes to Cardinal Health

Operations is responsible for materials handling and product distribution in a distribution or manufacturing environment. Includes warehousing and fulfillment of materials and products, transportation, inventory management as well as demand, supply and manufacturing planning.

Inventory Management is accountable for the design and execution of demand planning and customer forecasting systems, supply planning, product deployment and expediting processes, and the development and implementation of a stocking optimization model to minimize costs and inventory while delivering on service requirements.

Job Summary

The Senior Coordinator, Inventory Management analyzes existing inventory and resolves inbound discrepancies in order to drive the operational efficiency of pharmacy warehouse operations. The Senior Coordinator validates inbound shipments, places electronic orders, creates standard inventory reports and forecasts, and leads regular cycle counts. By ensuring the quality and efficiency of inventory management, this job contributes to customer satisfaction and minimizing the facility’s expenses.

Responsibilities in this Role

  • Receives inbound products from manufacturers and checks packing slips to ensure that the quantity of product matches the slips and the order placed. Enters and validates product data in the database and releases product for use in the facility.
  • Develops forecasts of inventory based on customer demand, orders, and shipment speeds of various products and manufacturers.
  • Places electronic orders based on inventory reporting and forecasting. Communicates with manufacturers as necessary to provide additional order information.
  • Monitors inventory levels continually and runs reports from database to analyze slow-moving products, fast-moving products, and expiration date data.
  • Evaluates quantity discrepancies and quality issues, such as damaged products and enters issues into database and contacts manufacturers to identify and resolve the issue and, as necessary, escalates the issue to the Manager, Pharmacy Services.
  • Conducts regular cycle counts by developing count lists, providing lists and instruction to Pharmacy Technicians and other staff, and collecting and validating the count data.
  • Manages the storage and outbound logistics of product returns to manufacturers as well as quarantined products. Edits data in the PMS based on the products’ National Drug Codes.

Qualifications

  • Ability to work in accordance with safety requirements
  • Work Inbound/Outbound Exceptions

  • FCA's

  • Related QIC functions

Job Title: Bilingual Transportation Manager/Gestionnaire de transport bilingue at Cardinal Health
Job Description:
Cardinal Health, with over 1300 employees in Canada, is an essential link in the Canadian healthcare supply chain, providing over 70,000 products to healthcare facilities and medical professionals across the country.

As a member of the national Transportation team and located at our Distribution Center in Dorval, this individual will play a key role in ensuring execution of our Transportation strategy while providing leadership and direction to our Operations Control Center team, Dispatch and Private Fleet Supervisor. The Transportation Manager will work closely with and influence multiple internal stakeholders such as Operations, Sales, RAQA and Finance. This role is responsible for all facets of Transportation carrier compliance and the overall private fleet and Operations control budget for the Central region.

For more information on what it is like to work for us, please watch this video: Cardinal Health - Wings .

Your Contributions to the Organization will be :

  • Developing, coaching and providing daily direction to a team of 7 direct reports, including Dispatchers, Operations Control Coordinators and Private Fleet Supervisor as well as indirectly manage a team of 25 drivers

  • Assessing training needs and recommend appropriate solutions

  • Managing outbound and replenishment freight expenses through accurate measurements and controls that improve the overall efficiency of the organization and reduce costs

  • Owning management of KPI data accuracy, efficiency of Private Fleet operations and overall transportation budget for the Central region

  • Reviewing, analyzing and propose solutions around outbound freight expenses through accurate measurements and controls to manage costs

  • Visiting and liaise with our service providers to build effective partnerships and constantly monitor performance with the goal of improving efficiency and reducing costs in the network

  • After careful analysis, prepare management recommendations, such as proposed fee and tariff increases or schedule changes

  • Direct the effectiveness of private, third party and contract carrier systems

  • Engaging and ensuring alignment between key internal and external stakeholders in transportation processes, including the establishment and or changes to policies, standards, procedures and rates

  • Directing and managing corporate governance and regulatory compliance procedures related to transportation activities

  • Ensuring National Transportation Policy is being executed according to established procedures and collaborate with internal stakeholders to drive accountability

  • Working with Director on national sourcing strategies from initiation to contract execution, including pricing and contract negotiations

  • Remain current with latest transportation technology systems, procedures and best practices

This Job might be for you if:

  • Bilingual – Fluent in both French and English

  • Completed a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Operations, Supply Chain or related fields preferred

  • Possess 7+ years in transportation position with 5+ years in a management role

  • You’ve managed professionals as well as large hourly workforce is an asset

  • You have strong cross-functional collaboration skills and ability to influence others through demonstrated expertise

  • Possess extensive transportation experience with carriers and private fleet operations

  • You have strong industry knowledge of transportation processes, technologies and industry best practices, procedures & processes

  • You possess highly developed data management skills, an understanding of order and data systems, freight tariffs, with a strong knowledge of Microsoft Office products

  • You’re able to interact & negotiate successfully with wide range of clients and warehouse personnel

  • You’re able  to initiate and manage change and prioritize team’s workload and tasks according to changing business needs

  • You are analytical, as well as strategic thinking required; flexible, creative, process and service oriented

  • You have proven interpersonal and communication skills
